The analysis of the game totals reveals that while some games feature high scores and others low, the key factor appears to be the relative performance of each team. Games where both teams perform around their average result in higher total points (e.g., 66), whereas situations where one team excels significantly and another struggles lead to lower totals (e.g., 30). This suggests that team performance variability is a significant driver of varying game totals, indicating that no single trend dominates but rather the outcomes are influenced by how well each team performs relative to their typical standards.
